place: Seefeldstrasse 54, parterre rechts, Zurich VIII, Switzerland
author: James Joyce
text: Dear Miss Weaver: Many thanks for your letter. Please use the press notices of my stories in whatever way seems best to you. enclose slips to be inserted in the copies sent out to the following addresses (the first three, however, are not to contain slips): 1) John Joyce 2) Michael Healy 3) Mrs Murray 4) W.B. Yeats 5) Arthur Symons 6) William Archer 7) H.G. Wells 8) Lady Cunard 9) Edmund Gosse 10) George Moore 11) Edward Marsh As I have had no news whatever from my agent I shall feel greatly obliged if you will please write to me as soon as you hear from him or from the publisher in New York. I thank you also for your kind inquiry about the book I am writing. I am working at it as well as I can. It is called Ulysses and the action takes place in Dublin in 1904. I have almost finished the first part and have written out part of the middle and end. I hope to finish it in 1918. With very kind regards sincerely yours James Joyce
